axis_supply.supply_status: CRITICAL - Post-Operation Crusader depletion. Extended supply lines from Tripoli (850-1000+ km) via single coastal road (Via Balbia). British naval interdiction (Malta-based RAF/RN) destroys 30-40% of Axis convoys. Fuel reserves 5 days (same as DAK critical shortage), ammunition 8 days, water 11L/man/day (barely adequate desert minimum). DAK convoy arrived 5 Jan 1942 (55 tanks total enabling counter-offensive). Division share: ~25 tanks. Supply base: Tripoli port with forward dump at Benghazi recaptured 29 Jan 1942 (critical port). Capture of British supply dumps at Agedabia/Benghazi essential for sustained operations. Division logistics rebuilt after Crusader but still strained.

allied_supply.supply_status: Severely strained after Battle of Agedabia (21-24 Jan). Lost 117 tanks. Defensive posture at Gazala. Fuel and ammunition resupply from Tobruk (150km) and Egypt (600km). Water critical constraint in desert operations. Division withdrawn to refit and rebuild tank strength from ~150 to ~105 operational tanks by end Q1.
